Year: Age You Plan to Stop Working
Spouse's Age You Plan to Stop Working
Mike will file for his own benefit to start on 11/1/2018, the month after he turns 70 and receive 132% of his full retirement age benefit.
Noga will file for her own benefit to start on 9/1/2027, the month after she turns 70 and receive 128% of her full retirement age benefit.
After she is widowed Noga will receive her survivor's benefit which will be 132% of Mike's full retirement age benefit.
The optimal filing solution results in a net-present-value of $2,431,378
In contrast, if the client filed at 67 and the spouse filed at 65 the net-present-value of their combined benefit would be $2,133,178
